nodes.bodyText: We already have a class for storing proxy related information. It's called ProxyInfo

Ya I was going to just use that class but it doesn't have a field for nonProxyHosts.  I assumed that field was important based on its presence in the Java Networking API, but if it's not, then I agree we should just use ProxyInfo.  Or I guess I could talk to Eric about editing integration-rest...
What about the other proxy properties? Such as blackduck.proxy.username, blackduck.proxy.password, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.workstation, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.domain

I would get the ProxyInfo from ConnectionManager if you can. 
  
    
      synopsys-detect/detect-configuration/src/main/java/com/synopsys/integration/detect/configuration/ConnectionManager.java
    
    
         Line 53
      in
      adf1481
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ProxyInfo getBlackDuckProxyInfo() throws DetectUserFriendlyException {

The current workaround for the customer is to add these arguments to the custom gradle build command. Will supplying multiple of the same arguments cause a problem with gradle? If so should we attempt to de-duplicate the argument the way we do the "dependencies" argument.
